review: For $30 it's o.k.  I primarily wanted it to be able to stream a video content from a webpage using a notebook to my HDTV.  That works, although the sound is less than desired.  So it meets the primary objective - barely.  It's works fine when 'casting' from both Windows 7 and MacAir.  However, highly disappointed when trying to stream a webpage (using Chrome app) from iOS (iPhone 5 or iPad).  Basically, you can't do it.  The cast extension is not available for the iOS devices .... booooo.  For $30 bucks, I'll keep it.  Not super excited about it though.

review: I have been an user of Roku for almost 4 years and one thing Roku lacked is a YouTube App. I got the chromecast just to watch youtube on TV. And it works really well. I have watched many movies on youtube using chromecast and it never failed.Unlike Roku, this does not take up any soace and its hidden behind your TV. However there aren't many apps using chromecast at this time. I would like to do web browsing and watch photos through chromecast. Hope it comes soon.Regarding the streaming quality - I have a DSL connection at home with speed hovering around 2.5 Mbps and chromecast has worked pretty well so far.I would recommend this product.
